reviewText:
I am honestly having a lot of fun with this game. Keep in mind that it still feels very much like an alpha / beta as some skills arent implemented yet (Parrying) or are incredibly time consuming to try and level (Taming). Likewise, there are a few systems that feel like they need a little more tweaking / work, but all things considered, its an ejoyable free-roam-open-world-min/max-exploration RPG.

Pros:

Mercenary System - Hire followers to help you out in battle, some of whom are actually fairly well scripted (Cleric / Mage / Warrior)

Monster Taming - Tame monsters to fight along side you, each monster has different strengths or reasons as to why you'd use them. However, as of this writing, monsters do not seem to level or gain stats from using them, so you will be forced to swap out weaker monsters for stronger ones, even if you happen to like the one that you already have.

Extensive Skill System - You dont gain levels in the traditional sense, instead your skills dictate your stat growth, and how powerful your character is. There also does not appear to be any restriction on skills, so if you enjoy min/maxing like I do, you can master everything with enough time invested.

Maps - In game maps have been introduced, which mark the locations of enemies near you, and points of interest near you (chests, items, entrances / exits)

Open World - The guild hall in the first town will give you occasional hints at things you can do within the world, pointing you in the direction of places to explore. However, you are allowed to run around and play any way that you'd like, which is a pro in my opinion.

Mouse Movement, Hotkeys, and User Interface - Everything is done by clicking to move or to attack an enemy, and spells or items can be set to a hotbar (1-9) for easy access during combat. Likewise, the user interface is very well done and somewhat reminiscent of Ragnarok Online. It is easily one of the most innovative systems that I have seen created on the RPGMaker engine.

Cons:

Subpar English Translation - The text and content is fairly unintelligible in a lot of dialogues. Luckily, everything is fairly easy to figure out on its own. I have heard that they are working on this, but as of right now, a lot of the text just simply does not make sense in english.

Magic System - While this is actually a pretty interesting and well done system on its own, it can be rather frustrating to try and figure out what spells require which reagents. It would be nice if the description of a spell also included what reagents it required, but as for now, just buy 10 of every reagent and cast a spell; to figure out what reagent that spell requires. (Then buy more, if you plan on using that spell).

Lack of Explanation on Skills - This may just be a symptom of the poor english translation, but it would be nice if skills were explained a bit better. Most are easy enough to figure out, but I would want to know (for instance) how much raising my skills influences my strength and HP growth. That is to say, what secondary effects skills influence, other than the obvious 'You have a higher to-hit with attacks.'

Lack of Content / Storyline - There is already a lot to do within the game, places to explore and chests to plunder. While I havent accomplished everything, or killed every monster (Dragons, Giants, and Demons are rough) it definitely feels like it needs more content. I enjoy the open-world-free-roam aspect, it would be nice if there was more of a quest system or loose storyline to explore.



Conclusion:

For the price, I might say to wait on it a little bit longer, for some of the systems to be fleshed out and more content to be introduced, but it is definitely playable, and I have not ran into any game-breaking bugs personally. Its fun and enjoyable for what it is, but if the idea of just building up a character and exploring (without any real direction from a storyline) doesnt sound fun to you, you may want to pass. That being said, I happen to be having a blast with this little game, and I look forward to future updates. =]

reviewText:
Ok first off this game is awesome. Has so much potential and is exactly what I would look for in a game right now.

It takes UO, and Zelda for the NES and mashes them together... That is a win win

It has a long way to go but I hope to see it continue please try this game out if you are any kind of old school gamer

reviewText:
From what I've played so far, the game is buggy but playable!

During the start of the game, the first thing you might notice is the translation. Not everything has been converted to english yet. The images in the tutorial section still uses the Japanese screenshots, which I don't mind, but it might confuse some players. The game is very open ended... I found myself wandering around trying to figure out what to do, but eh, I don't mind randomly killing mobs and getting stronger.

A bug I've encountered so far was during Taming. There are some times when I select to tame monster, the TAMING" notice doesn't appear

reviewText: So far so good, it loosely reminds me of Ultima Online, which I deeply enjoyed back then. I've always enjoyed JRPG or anime themed games and to combine the two - it's a good concept with incredible potential. I truly wish that something like this could be taken online and developed seriously (meaning big budget and team of developers) into an MMO.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is unfortunatey buggy as hell.  The translations definitely need work, though I think that is something that they are still sorting out.  My character got trapped in the starting building after finishing the tutorials.  I want to say that this game is worth a try, but they need to get some stuff fixed before I can genuinely endorse it.  Beyond the odd translations and the buggy issues, the game has been fun otherwise.
